summary: This document is an email chain from July 16, 2019, discussing a tip from Susan Harriman regarding Jeffrey Epstein's financial activities. The emails show law enforcement officials coordinating how to handle her information, directing her to official channels. Harriman's emails contain allegations about Epstein's investments and board connections.

events.title: Tip Coordination Regarding Epstein Finances
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI Special Agents coordinate via email on how to handle unsolicited tips from Susan Harriman regarding Jeffrey Epstein's financial investments, directing her to contact the official FBI tip line.

events.title: Harriman's Initial Email Allegation
events.description: Susan Harriman sends an email alleging specific financial activities by Jeffrey Epstein, pointing to his Form 990 report showing concentrated purchases in TenCent and Western Digital.

keyFacts: A tipster named Susan Harriman was actively sending unsolicited financial allegations about Jeffrey Epstein to the U.S. Attorney's Office in July 2019, shortly after his indictment.
Harriman's allegations focused on Epstein's Form 990, claiming more than half the proceeds of a foundation were bet on TenCent and Western Digital stocks.
Harriman attempted to draw connections between Epstein's investments and Iain Ferguson Bruce, an accountant on the Audit Committee of TenCent.
Law enforcement officials in the email chain are shown carefully managing the tip, deciding not to engage directly but to direct Harriman to the official FBI tip line.
The document reveals an active period of public tips and financial scrutiny following Epstein's indictment, with individuals attempting to link him to broader corporate networks.
